text: Engen (延元) was a of the Southern Court during the Nanboku-chō period after Kemmu and before Kōkoku. This period started in February 1336 and ended in April 1340.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Engen" in Japan encyclopedia, p. 178. The monarchs during this time were Nussbaum, "Go-Daigo Tennō," p. 251. and .Nussbaum, "Go-Murakami Tennō," p. 257. The Northern Court pretender in Kyoto was .Nussbaum, "Go-Kōmyō Tennō," p. 256; Titsingh, Isaac. (1834). Annales des empereurs du japon, pp. 294-297. ==Events of the Engen era== * 17 May 1336 (Engen 1, 6th day of the 4th month): Former-Emperor Go-Fushimi died.Titsingh, p. 295; Imperial Household Agency (Kunaichō), 後伏見天皇 (93); retrieved 2012-10-1. * 19 September 1339 (Engen 4, 16th day of the 8th month): Emperor Go-Daigo died. "Go-Daigo," Encyclopedia Britannica; retrieved 2012-10-2. * 1340 (Engen 5): Sightings of a "broom star" (comet) are recorded.Pankenier, David. (1999).
